byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro; Patricia Torres from Barinas; María Eugenia Díaz from Caracas, Venezuela; and Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires.

abstract: Former Venezuelan Pres Hugo Chavez's home state of Barinas delivers landslide defeat to Chavez's United Socialist Party in legislative elections; state has long been staunch supporter of Chavez and his party, in light of millions lavished by him on state; defeat points to anger over country's economy.
lead_paragraph: Last week, in a gut blow for the movement known as Chavismo, Venezuela turned raw anger over economic hardship into a landslide victory for the political opposition in crucial elections.

headline.main: As Economy Lags, Hugo Chávez’s Movement Fades in Venezuela
headline.print_headline: Chávez’s Home Rejects Legacy as Boom Fades

snippet: Last week, in a gut blow for the movement known as Chavismo, Venezuela turned raw anger over economic hardship into a landslide victory for the political opposition in crucial elections.
